titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Athletic Association of Western Universities Records
Athletic Association of Western Universities Records

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Athletic Association of Western Universities records
did.abstract: Collection includes minutes, agenda, correspondence, memoranda, schedules, reports, and other records pertaining to game schedules, policies and procedures, financial matters, the Rose Bowl arrangements, and other administrative matters. These materials were originally sent to the president's office at Stanford University.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Athletic Association of Western Universities Records (SC0792). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The AAWU, a successor to the Pacific Coast Conference, was founded on July 1, 1959 with Cal, Stanford, UCLA, USC and Washington as charter members. Washington State joined in 1962; Oregon and Oregon State joined in 1964. The name was changed again in 1968 to Pacific-8 Conference.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection includes minutes, agenda, correspondence, memoranda, schedules, reports, and other records pertaining to game schedules, policies and procedures, financial matters, the Rose Bowl arrangements, and other administrative matters. These materials were originally sent to the president's office at Stanford University.
